content: I'm working on fixing #89307 but it's my first time submitting code upstream to LLVM and I was wondering what the conventions are there. I've read their Contributing guide but it wasn't clear: do I also need to create a bug on bugzilla before opening a PR on phabricator or is it ok to just show up with a fix? The change itself is quite small.
It's okay to just submit a fix. Though if you want to get it merged to the release branch, you'll have to open a bug.
You can also choose to just cherry pick your patch into our fork.
I don't think it must go into the release branch so I'll just cherry-pick into our fork. Thanks!! :smile:
Finally figured out Phabricator. Thanks for your help everyone! https://reviews.llvm.org/D110719
IIRC, there may be two places to update - https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/86419#discussion_r660765939.
(Although the second one shouldn't affect rustc.)
From testing, I believe clang mangles these symbols correctly but I will double check. Thanks for the pointer!
It's been merged into LLVM upstream so I have a cherry-pick PR open https://github.com/rust-lang/llvm-project/pull/116.
